Reviews.Content: Novelty aside, this is a great budget find in Tokyo We stayed at the Asakusa Riverside Capsule Hotel for 1 night during our visit to Tokyo and it was an all round great experience. When you enter you have to pay for your capsule using a vending machine and then take off your shoes and clothes and change into the slippers and pyjamas that are provided. Men and women sleep on different floors with a communal area on the top floor with a tradition Japanese bathhouse and great views of Tokyo.The location is excellent, on the riverside with a subway station just across the road and aside from the novelty aspect of capsule hotels; this place is also really good value for money for those on a budget in an expensive city like Tokyo. Both the communal areas and the capsules are very clean and I would most definitely recommend this place to travelers on a budget or someone just wanting to experience the real Tokyo.
